titleStmt.title: An Encoded Transcription of Material from the Sylvia Beach Papers

msIdentifier.repository: Princeton University. Library. Dept. of Rare Books and Special Collections

change.ab: Transcribed cards. s1: <*> (address) = crossed out, hard to read <*> (Rhode) = note written in pencil, bit under date illegible <*> <*> (SB took them) = another pencil note, faint and difficult to read s3: postcard, top is a mess of stamps and writing in French that I can't decipher s4: No writing. Back of postcard, abstract image (trees?) s5: <*> (under address) = "maillot"? doesn't make sense <*> (under "renewed") = "wale"? (crossed out) <*> (3 July) = "grona"? s6: <*> (13 Aug) = "scrimple"? <*> (Oct 11) = "Shel Line"?

body.ab:
DENNIS Mrs Frederic Dennis Villa West Hartlepool. avenue toulouse due Toulouse <*> Saint Enogat Dinand
June 8 paid 30.00 12 Long Christmas dinner June 19 post. 2.80 Master of the House June 19 June 19 Poems T S Eliot 3 July post. 3.40 America as Americans see it 3 July 3 July All men are enemies 27 " 3 July Rhodes send a list of poss. <*> books 27" post. 3.40 What life should mean to you Aug 28 26 July Second Common Reader Sept 4 p. 3.40 Aug 21 SB Took them C. <*> Modern France Mont St michel & Chartres <*> Album Sept 11 Europe since the War Oct 5 Sept 8 sent Laroune p. 4.20

received this card Jan 11 already written Jan 10
1934 DENNIS 19 rue Perronet (Neuilly) Mrs A.L.P. Dennis <*>. 24.08 (Mary Cable Dennis) train St. Lazare 8.45 Rien du tout to Diéppe arr. 11.30 Berneval ze Grand Post Office Seine inférieure Berneval le Grand (Seine Inférieure) 12 Sept 24 sent stamps for subsc NO Postage post 4,60 (send 17v) Sept 19 Life of Oscar Wilde, Sherard Sept 27 p. 4.60 Oscar Wilde, Ransome | paid Oscar Wilde, F. Harris vol II | Sept 27 Characters & Commentaries 3 2,20 De Profundis 3 Oct 65 Oct 3 Marie Antoinette, Zweig 11 " p. 2.80 9 Oct: Berlin Diaries 19 p. 4.60 Six women of the world (extra) 19 19 Oct. Cte. de Tully_ Memoirs 30 Oct p. 4f Catharine the Great } 30 Oct. p. 1.45 Modern Tragedy } extra 30 " postage paid June 1st - Dec 1st 1935 Renewed for 6 months 2 vols 100v will <*> send registered send first parcel end of week May June 1/ St Ignatius Loyola 11 p. 3.80 Tobit Transplanted 11 June
8 June- Forests of Normandy 3 20 yrs a'growing 3 Erasmus 24 So Red the Rose 24 loaned to SB book on Mr. Cable 3 July - Dusk at <*> - Seventh age p. 5.80 - Portrait of Zelide } 25 July 9.60 Bacon

1 old book 180 paid by mo July 4 1 new book old credit 21.60 postage May 31 3.20 Mary Shelley June 9 Ben Jonson and King James June 9 Walled Towns of France (S.B.'s copy) June 9 5.60 Warrant for X June 23 Destiny of France June 23 June 25 5.60 this Proud Heart July 9 to Wake the Dead July 9 Anne of Brittany July 9 July 9 7.80 Basque Country, Fedden July 21 Found Floating July 21 Thirteen O'Clock July 21 Best China Stories July 30 Goodman of Paris Sept 1 post: 13,60 Memoirs of La Gde Mademoiselle Sept 1 Dead Don't Care Sept 1 Warrant for X Sept 1 Other Side Sept 1 Far Away & Long Ago Sept 1
